title: Prek: forbid Cyrillic characters (strict)
description:
Goal: Enforce a repo-wide policy: no Cyrillic characters in tracked files.

Why:
- Keep code/config/docs consistent and easy to search/review.

How:
- Add a prek hook that scans staged/all files for `\p{Script=Cyrillic}` and fails on matches.

Done when:
- `uvx prek run no-cyrillic --all-files` passes.
- The hook fails when Cyrillic is introduced.
close_reason: Added prek hook + script to block Cyrillic in non-translation files; documented policy in AGENTS.md.

title: Add --examples flag for domain expertise injection
description:
Goal: Allow domain expertise injection via example ideas file

Why:
- Generic LLM ideation lacks domain-specific quality benchmarks
- Experts have tacit knowledge hard to encode in prompts
- Few-shot examples improve output quality significantly

How:
- Add --examples flag to /evoidea skill
- Parse JSON file with gold-standard ideas
- Inject into GENERATE prompt as style anchors
- Inject into CRITIC prompt as scoring benchmarks

TDD: Test that --examples flag parses JSON and includes content in prompts

Done when:

- Examples appear in GENERATE phase prompt
- Examples appear in CRITIC phase prompt
- 2-3 bundled examples shipped (saas.json, devtools.json)

title: Task: Capture rationales in tournament comparisons
description:
Goal: Optionally collect a short rationale (free-text or criterion tags) for each tournament choice and persist it in `preferences.json`.
Why:
- Rubric scores may not fully capture what a user likes; rationales provide higher-signal supervision.
- Enables better refinement prompts and future learning beyond simple weights.
How:
- Update `evoidea tournament` UI to ask for an optional rationale after A/B choice.
- Store as `rationale` (string) and/or `tags` (array) on each comparison object.
- Keep backwards compatibility for existing preference files.
TDD: Unit test that comparison records include optional rationale fields and JSON round-trips.
Done when:
- Tournament writes rationale fields when provided.
- Existing preference files still load.
Refs: evoidea-trn

title: Pipeline core: Phase trait + Pipeline runner + Orchestrator loop (integration tests)
description:
Goal: Implement the pipeline core: Phase trait, Pipeline runner, and Orchestrator loop with Storage.

Why:
- This is the project backbone: phases must plug in without rewriting the core.

How:
- Phase: name() + run(state, ctx) -> state.
- Pipeline: ordered list of phases from config.
- Orchestrator: init_run, iterate, evaluate stop conditions, update best/stagnation.
- Append history events per step (generated/scored/selected/.../stopped).

TDD:
- First test: a pipeline of 1-2 dummy phases mutates state; history is written; stop by max_rounds.

Done when:
- A minimal end-to-end mock integration test creates `runs/<run_id>/` and `history.ndjson`.
close_reason: Implemented in single session: Rust CLI with full MVP pipeline (generate/critic/select/refine), FileStorage, MockLlmProvider, 36 passing tests, schemas materialized, skill created

title: Add constraint guardrails to REFINE phase
description:
Goal: Prevent REFINE phase from adding scope that violates constraints

Why:
- Meta-evolution run showed refinements transforming simple ideas into multi-month projects
- 'Visual Tree' became 'SDK for any AI tools' (violated timeline)
- 'Domain Examples' became 'Marketplace' (violated forbidden list)

How:
- Add constraint reminder to REFINE prompt in skill file
- Include explicit "do NOT add" list for common scope creep patterns
- Re-state original constraints before refinement instructions

TDD: Manual test - run evolution with constraints, verify refined ideas stay in scope

Done when:
- REFINE prompt includes constraint guardrails
- Refined ideas respect timeline/forbidden constraints
close_reason: Added constraint guardrails to REFINE prompt

Goal: Add prek (pre-commit compatible) and document standards for tasks/commits (what/why/how) and TDD cadence.

- Fast feedback loop before pushes (fmt/clippy/tests + repo hygiene).
- Consistent writing: tasks/commits should explain not only what, but also why/how.

How:

- Update `AGENTS.md` templates and TDD cadence section.

Done when:

- `uvx prek run --all-files` passes.

title: Add --discover flag for interactive pre-flight questions
description:
Goal: Add discovery phase to evoidea that asks clarifying questions before idea generation

Why:
- Current prompt + constraints approach misses user context (skills, time, preferences)
- Brainstorming session proved 5 targeted questions dramatically improve generation quality
- Users don't always know what constraints to specify upfront

How:
- Add `--discover` flag to evoidea command
- Define 5 core questions with multiple-choice answers:
  1. Skills/experience (dev, design, marketing, ai, other)
  2. Time available (4-8h, 10-16h, 20h+)
  3. Business model (saas, api, one-time, marketplace)
  4. Target audience (developers, business, creators, freelancers)
  5. Tech approach (llm-based, llm-assisted, no-llm)
- Map answers to constraints automatically (e.g., "4-8h" â†’ timeline_weeks: 1)
- Store discovery results in config.json under "discovery" key
- Skip if constraints already provided via CLI flags

TDD: Test that discovery answers correctly map to constraints in config.json

Done when:
- `evoidea "prompt" --discover` asks 5 questions interactively
- Answers auto-populate constraints
- Discovery results saved in config.json
- Can skip with explicit --budget/--timeline/etc flags

title: Research: Multi-agent studio mode (C)
description:
Goal: Define a multi-agent "studio" loop (tech/biz/wild/skeptic) that increases novelty without tanking quality.
Why:
- Single-agent generation tends to regress to the mean; role separation widens the search space.
- A skeptic pass prevents happy-path hallucinations and forces sharper ideas.
- Enables quality-diversity style exploration (keep diverse candidates alive).
How:
- Specify agent roles, prompts, and handoff contract (inputs/outputs).
- Define orchestration: generate -> critique -> select -> refine, plus skeptic/repair stages.
- Propose a quality-diversity selection heuristic (novelty buckets, diversity slots, or QDHF-inspired retention).
- Define cost/latency controls and determinism constraints for tests.
TDD: Integration test with mock agent outputs verifying orchestration + stable selection.
Done when:
- Design sketch with an MVP agent set and stage graph.
- Follow-up implementation issues (small slices).

title: CLI: run/resume/show/validate (MVP) + integration tests for artifacts
description:

Why:

How:
- `run`: parse flags, run orchestrator, print run_id.
- `show`: read state/final and render json or markdown.
- `validate`: verify artifacts exist and basic invariants hold (JSON parses, best_idea_id exists, etc.).

TDD:

title: Add visual evolution tree command (ASCII/HTML)
description:
Goal: Visualize idea evolution as ancestry tree

Why:
- Evolution is black box - users can't see WHY ideas won
- No way to trace refinement paths or see which changes helped
- Understanding lineage helps learn what makes ideas improve

How:
- Add 'evoidea tree' subcommand to Rust CLI
- Parse state.json for idea lineage (parents field)
- Render ASCII tree: idea-001 -> idea-001-r1 -> idea-001-r2
- Optional --html flag for standalone HTML visualization

TDD: Unit test tree rendering with mock state.json containing 3-gen lineage

- Tree shows scores at each node
- Tree shows archived vs active status

title: Feature: Export derived criterion weights in profile
description:
Goal: Extend `evoidea profile export` to include a `derived.criterion_weights` block computed from tournament comparisons.
Why:
- Elo rankings are run-specific; criterion weights generalize across runs.
- Enables a minimal preference-learning loop without training models.
- Keeps everything local-first and deterministic.
How:
- Read `runs/<run_id>/preferences.json` + `state.json` and join comparisons -> rubric score vectors.
- Implement a deterministic pairwise weight-fitting method (e.g., multiplicative weights with normalization).
- Add `derived.fit` stats (comparisons_used, seeded holdout accuracy).
- Keep output backwards-compatible (`version: 1`, new fields optional).
TDD: Unit tests for weight fitting on a small synthetic comparison set (deterministic split).
Done when:
- `evoidea profile export` outputs `derived.criterion_weights` and `derived.fit`.
- `cargo test` passes.
Refs: evoidea-trn

How:

title: Feature: Apply profile-derived weights in /evoidea
description:
Goal: Let `/evoidea` accept a profile/weights file and apply the derived criterion weights during scoring, selection, and refinement.
Why:
- Closes the preference-learning loop: tournament -> profile -> better next run.
- Improves alignment to a specific user without ingesting private context.
- Keeps the core rubric but adapts its importance ordering per user.
How:
- Add a new optional flag to the command contract: `--profile <path>` (or `--weights <path>`).
- Persist the applied weights in `runs/<run_id>/config.json`.
- Compute `overall_score` as a weighted sum (instead of simple average).
- In REFINE, choose weakest areas by weighted deficiency (e.g., w[i] * (10 - score[i])).
- (Optional) include top-2 weighted priorities in critic/refiner prompts.
TDD: Deterministic test run fixture showing that weights change ranking/selection outputs.
Done when:
- A run with a profile produces different selection than uniform weights (when expected).
- Artifacts record the applied weights.
Refs: evoidea-trn

description:
Goal: Add Crossover and Mutation phases to generate new ideas with parents/origin invariants.

Why:
- Variation is required: new ideas should not come only from the initial generator.

How:

- Mutation: pick ideas (top + random), pick mutation_type, call mutator, add mutation_count ideas with parents.
- Maintain invariants for origin/parents/gen.

TDD:

title: Research: Personalized mentor context pack (B)
description:
Goal: Design a safe, local-first "context pack" that makes idea generation/refinement user-specific.
Why:
- Matches the "AI mentor" concept: relevant ideas require knowing the user's background.
- Improves perceived quality (less generic ideas, more actionable constraints).
- Creates a foundation for proactive suggestions later.
How:
- Define what sources are allowed (run history, explicit user profile, optional repo summaries) and what is forbidden.
- Specify a context pack format (JSON) + compression rules (token/size budgets, redaction).
- Define prompt injection defenses and privacy boundaries.
- Sketch UX: how users provide/update profile and how it influences runs.
TDD: Unit tests for the context pack builder (size limits + secret/redaction invariants).
Done when:
- Proposed context pack schema + example.
- Clear MVP scope (what we will NOT ingest initially).
- Follow-up implementation issues.

title: Scoring/Selection: weighted sum + elite+diversity selection (unit tests)
description:
Goal: Implement overall score calculation (weighted sum) and elite+diversity selection logic.

Why:
- Selection is the core of the evolutionary loop; it must be correct and regression-tested.

How:
- Compute overall_score from per-criterion scores (0..10) using RunConfig weights.
- Implement selection: top elite_count + a small number of diversity slots (seeded).
- Ignore status=archived.

TDD:

Done when:
- Unit tests are green and logic is pure (no IO / provider).

description:

- Fits evoidea's evolutionary metaphor better

- Present two ideas side-by-side, ask user to pick winner
